item.description:
A poignant examination of how war affects the mind of a soldier, Sophocles’s tragedy speaks directly to our times.  Second only to Achilles in greatness and strength, the legendary Greek warrior Ajax struggles under the weight of psychological and physical injuries, trying to maintain his dignity, identity, and honor. Director Sarah Benson brings the voice of the community to this production, exploring the relationships between soldiers and civilians. I plan to stay for the post-performance Q&A discussion with the actors and then maybe have drinks and appetizers or a late lunch after if there is interest. I will give my cellphone number to the yeses.

The American Repertory Theatre in Cambridge has gotten better and better, and I have season tickets because everything they are doing this season is fantastic. PLEASE NOTE: I already have my ticket, since I have season tickets, so we won't be able to sit together as a group (unless you decide to buy tickets together), I just wanted to see if people wanted to join me. There is no group rate. YOU ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR BUYING YOUR OWN TICKET IN ADVANCE, RSVP-ing here does not guarantee attendance! Tickets are now on sale. Showtime is 2 p.m. Link to buy tickets: http://www.americanrepertorytheater.org/events/show/ajax
item.name: Ajax by Sophocles at A.R.T. in Cambridge
